body.p: The Board decided to add application requirements setting out some of the factors to consider when applying that judgement to situations in which no single party holds more than half the voting rights of an investee. In particular, the Board decided to clarify that it expects that:

li.p: the more voting rights an investor holds (ie the larger its absolute holding), the more likely it will have power over an investee;
the more voting rights an investor holds relative to other vote holders (ie the larger its relative holding), the more likely the investor will have power over an investee; and
the more parties that would need to act together to outvote the investor, the more likely the investor will have power over an investee.
